security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution capabilities. It guides AI behavior for Chinese language learning assistance. The skill instructs AI to use web search for finding real-world expression examples, which is legitimate educational use. No filesystem access, network code, or external commands are present.

content.user_title: Improve Chinese writing with natural expressions
content.value_statement: Chinese learners struggle to move beyond textbook expressions to natural native speech. This skill analyzes expressions for real-world usage and improves writing to sound fluent and natural like native speakers.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes Chinese expressions for usage context, formality level, and naturalness
Improves Chinese writing to sound like native speaker output
Finds real-world usage examples from Weibo, bilibili, and Zhihu
Provides variations of expressions from casual to formal
Teaches differences between textbook and actual native usage
Corrects common translation patterns from Japanese to natural Chinese
limitations: Does not teach grammar from scratch - assumes HSK4 level knowledge
Does not provide vocabulary lists or flashcards
Does not include audio pronunciation examples
Focuses on written Chinese, not speaking practice

use_cases.title: Analyze unfamiliar expressions
use_cases.description: When you encounter a Chinese phrase and want to understand when and how native speakers actually use it in daily life

use_cases.title: Fix translation habits
use_cases.description: When your Chinese sounds like direct Japanese translation and you want to write more naturally like a native speaker

use_cases.title: Prepare for conversations
use_cases.description: When you want to learn casual expressions used on social media and video comments for smoother native interactions

best_practices: Always provide context when asking about expressions - specify if you need casual or formal usage
Ask for multiple variations so you can choose based on your specific situation
Request real-world examples from web search to see how natives actually use the expression
Combine expression analysis with writing correction to reinforce learning
anti_patterns: Asking for grammar explanations from scratch - the skill assumes HSK4 knowledge
Expecting formal business Chinese - the skill focuses on natural conversational expressions
Requesting only single-word answers - the skill provides detailed analysis with examples
Skipping the web search examples - they are essential for learning real usage

faq.question: Which Claude tools support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude and Claude Code. Not optimized for Codex which focuses on code tasks rather than language learning.

faq.question: What Chinese level do I need?
faq.answer: Designed for HSK4 level and above. Assumes basic grammar knowledge and vocabulary of about 1200 words.

faq.question: Is my data safe?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no data collection. Web search examples come from public Chinese social media platforms.

faq.question: Why does it search the web?
faq.answer: Web search finds real examples from Weibo, bilibili, and Zhihu so you learn how natives actually use expressions in context.

faq.question: How is this different from translation apps?
faq.answer: Focuses on natural expression choice, not word-for-word translation. Teaches what natives actually say, not textbook definitions.
